00015   Node Node::createSelector(Complex_Selector* pSelector, Context& ctx) {
00016     NodeDequePtr null;
00017 
00018     Complex_Selector* pStripped = pSelector->clone(ctx);
00019     pStripped->tail(NULL);
00020     pStripped->combinator(Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF);
00021 
00022     return Node(SELECTOR, Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF, pStripped, null /*pCollection*/);

00044   Node::Node(const TYPE& type, Complex_Selector::Combinator combinator, Complex_Selector* pSelector, NodeDequePtr& pCollection)
00045   : got_line_feed(false), mType(type), mCombinator(combinator), mpSelector(pSelector), mpCollection(pCollection)

00049   Node Node::clone(Context& ctx) const {
00050     NodeDequePtr pNewCollection = make_shared<NodeDeque>();
00051     if (mpCollection) {
00052       for (NodeDeque::iterator iter = mpCollection->begin(), iterEnd = mpCollection->end(); iter != iterEnd; iter++) {
00053         Node& toClone = *iter;
00054         pNewCollection->push_back(toClone.clone(ctx));
00055       }
00056     }
00057 
00058     return Node(mType, mCombinator, mpSelector ? mpSelector->clone(ctx) : NULL, pNewCollection);
00059   }

00062   bool Node::contains(const Node& potentialChild, bool simpleSelectorOrderDependent) const {
00063         bool found = false;
00064 
00065     for (NodeDeque::iterator iter = mpCollection->begin(), iterEnd = mpCollection->end(); iter != iterEnd; iter++) {
00066       Node& toTest = *iter;
00067 
00068       if (nodesEqual(toTest, potentialChild, simpleSelectorOrderDependent)) {
00069         found = true;
00070         break;
00071       }
00072     }
00073 
00074     return found;
00075   }

00078   bool Node::operator==(const Node& rhs) const {
00079         return nodesEqual(*this, rhs, true /*simpleSelectorOrderDependent*/);

00083   bool nodesEqual(const Node& lhs, const Node& rhs, bool simpleSelectorOrderDependent) {
00084     if (lhs.type() != rhs.type()) {
00085       return false;
00086     }
00087 
00088     if (lhs.isCombinator()) {
00089 
00090         return lhs.combinator() == rhs.combinator();
00091 
00092     } else if (lhs.isNil()) {
00093 
00094       return true; // no state to check
00095 
00096     } else if (lhs.isSelector()){
00097 
00098       return selectors_equal(*lhs.selector(), *rhs.selector(), simpleSelectorOrderDependent);
00099 
00100     } else if (lhs.isCollection()) {
00101 
00102       if (lhs.collection()->size() != rhs.collection()->size()) {
00103         return false;
00104       }
00105 
00106       for (NodeDeque::iterator lhsIter = lhs.collection()->begin(), lhsIterEnd = lhs.collection()->end(),
00107            rhsIter = rhs.collection()->begin(); lhsIter != lhsIterEnd; lhsIter++, rhsIter++) {
00108 
00109         if (!nodesEqual(*lhsIter, *rhsIter, simpleSelectorOrderDependent)) {
00110           return false;
00111         }
00112 
00113       }
00114 
00115       return true;
00116 
00117     }
00118 
00119     // We shouldn't get here.
00120     throw "Comparing unknown node types. A new type was probably added and this method wasn't implemented for it.";
00121   }

00124   void Node::plus(Node& rhs) {
00125         if (!this->isCollection() || !rhs.isCollection()) {
00126         throw "Both the current node and rhs must be collections.";
00127     }
00128         this->collection()->insert(this->collection()->end(), rhs.collection()->begin(), rhs.collection()->end());
00129   }

00131 #ifdef DEBUG
00132   ostream& operator<<(ostream& os, const Node& node) {
00133 
00134     if (node.isCombinator()) {
00135 
00136       switch (node.combinator()) {
00137         case Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF: os << "\" \""; break;
00138         case Complex_Selector::PARENT_OF:   os << "\">\""; break;
00139         case Complex_Selector::PRECEDES:    os << "\"~\""; break;
00140         case Complex_Selector::ADJACENT_TO: os << "\"+\""; break;
00141       }
00142 
00143     } else if (node.isNil()) {
00144 
00145       os << "nil";
00146 
00147     } else if (node.isSelector()){
00148 
00149       To_String to_string;
00150       os << node.selector()->head()->perform(&to_string);
00151 
00152     } else if (node.isCollection()) {
00153 
00154                         os << "[";
00155 
00156       for (NodeDeque::iterator iter = node.collection()->begin(), iterBegin = node.collection()->begin(), iterEnd = node.collection()->end(); iter != iterEnd; iter++) {
00157         if (iter != iterBegin) {
00158           os << ", ";
00159         }
00160 
00161                                 os << (*iter);
00162       }
00163 
00164       os << "]";
00165 
00166     }
00167 
00168     return os;
00169 
00170   }
00171 #endif

00174   Node complexSelectorToNode(Complex_Selector* pToConvert, Context& ctx) {
00175     if (pToConvert == NULL) {
00176       return Node::createNil();
00177     }
00178 
00179     Node node = Node::createCollection();
00180 
00181     while (pToConvert) {
00182 
00183       // the first Complex_Selector may contain a dummy head pointer, skip it.
00184       if (pToConvert->head() != NULL && !pToConvert->head()->is_empty_reference()) {
00185         node.collection()->push_back(Node::createSelector(pToConvert, ctx));
00186       }
00187 
00188       if (pToConvert->combinator() != Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF) {
00189         node.collection()->push_back(Node::createCombinator(pToConvert->combinator()));
00190       }
00191 
00192       pToConvert = pToConvert->tail();
00193     }
00194 
00195     return node;
00196   }
00197 
00198 
00199   Complex_Selector* nodeToComplexSelector(const Node& toConvert, Context& ctx) {
00200     if (toConvert.isNil()) {
00201       return NULL;
00202     }
00203 
00204 
00205     if (!toConvert.isCollection()) {
00206       throw "The node to convert to a Complex_Selector* must be a collection type or nil.";
00207     }
00208 
00209 
00210     NodeDeque& childNodes = *toConvert.collection();
00211 
00212     string noPath("");
00213     Position noPosition(-1, -1, -1);
00214     Complex_Selector* pFirst = new (ctx.mem) Complex_Selector(ParserState("[NODE]"), Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF, NULL, NULL);
00215     Complex_Selector* pCurrent = pFirst;
00216 
00217     for (NodeDeque::iterator childIter = childNodes.begin(), childIterEnd = childNodes.end(); childIter != childIterEnd; childIter++) {
00218 
00219       Node& child = *childIter;
00220 
00221       if (child.isSelector()) {
00222         pCurrent->tail(child.selector()->clone(ctx));   // JMA - need to clone the selector, because they can end up getting shared across Node collections, and can result in an infinite loop during the call to parentSuperselector()
00223         pCurrent = pCurrent->tail();
00224       } else if (child.isCombinator()) {
00225         pCurrent->combinator(child.combinator());
00226 
00227         // if the next node is also a combinator, create another Complex_Selector to hold it so it doesn't replace the current combinator
00228         if (childIter+1 != childIterEnd) {
00229           Node& nextNode = *(childIter+1);
00230           if (nextNode.isCombinator()) {
00231             pCurrent->tail(new (ctx.mem) Complex_Selector(ParserState("[NODE]"), Complex_Selector::ANCESTOR_OF, NULL, NULL));
00232             pCurrent = pCurrent->tail();
00233           }
00234         }
00235       } else {
00236         throw "The node to convert's children must be only combinators or selectors.";
00237       }
00238     }
00239 
00240     // Put the dummy Compound_Selector in the first position, for consistency with the rest of libsass
00241     Compound_Selector* fakeHead = new (ctx.mem) Compound_Selector(ParserState("[NODE]"), 1);
00242     Selector_Reference* selectorRef = new (ctx.mem) Selector_Reference(ParserState("[NODE]"), NULL);
00243     fakeHead->elements().push_back(selectorRef);
00244     pFirst->head(fakeHead);
00245     pFirst->has_line_feed(pFirst->has_line_feed() || pFirst->tail()->has_line_feed() || toConvert.got_line_feed);
00246 
00247     return pFirst;
00248   }
